label: AB4C3_cI16_229_a_c_b-001
title: Model of Ferrite Structure (cI16)
comments: Ferritic steels are alloys of iron and other metals with an averaged body-centered cubic structure. This model represents one approximation for a ferritic steel. It is not meant to represent a real steel, and the selection of atom types for each Wyckoff position is arbitrary. If we replace the chromium atoms by nickel, this bcomes the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cP2_221_a_b-002}{CsCl ($B2$)} with $a_{B2} = 1/4 \, a$.  If we replace both the nickel and chromium atoms by iron, then the structure becomes \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{a body-centered cubic lattice ($A2$)} again with $a_{A2} = 1/4 \, a$.
